item.title: Persistent flooding on Old Gloucester Road (B4634) creating serious danger to road users and pedestrians, 6th February
item.description:
Old Gloucester Road (B4634), at what3words location ///deny.secret.posed There is persistent and worsening flooding at this location which creates a serious hazard for pedestrians, cyclists and motorists. This is a 50 mph road with blind bends. During and after rainfall, standing water covers a long stretch of carriageway and completely submerges the narrow footpath in places, forcing pedestrians into the live traffic lane. This route is used to reach nearby bus stops and the main cycle route. Drivers frequently move into the centre of the road to avoid the deepest water, which is extremely dangerous given the restricted visibility. Cyclists are particularly at risk. Debris and damaged car parts have been left at the roadside, indicating vehicles are striking submerged defects or suffering water-related damage. Floodwater appears to be emerging from one roadside drain rather than flowing into it. A nearby brook is not full when this occurs, suggesting that the drainage system between the road and the brook may be blocked, collapsed or inadequate. The worst areas remain flooded long after rainfall has stopped. This has been a longstanding issue for several years and appears to be getting worse each winter rather than improving. Please urgently investigate and resolve the drainage failure at this location.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inconsiderate and selfish parking by parents, 6th February
item.description:
Parents are parking on Brookfield Road from beyond Brookfield Lane up to Albermarle Road, It completely blocks the left hand side of the road and provides zero visibility, when parked on the bend and opposite a junction. Parking starts from around 2.30pm up to 3pm. Today I was by Chosen Hill school at 2.50pm waiting to overtake cars parked opposite the school entrance, when 6 vehicles overtook from behind the line of cars stuck behind the parked cars. They were on the right hand side of the road, blockimg on coming traffic from moving. They then used the school driveway to further overtake the 2 on coming vehicles and then continued driving up the road. I was absolutely astounded at how dangerous this was, it is an accident waiting to happen. If this had happened 10 mins later, the school driveway / entrance would have been full of school children. Parents park in such a way that prevents traffic from passing safely. They leave little space in between each parked car, making it almost impossible to overtake slowly, without 'running the gauntlet'. If 2 buses meet in opposite directions, it causes mayhem. Traffic measures are required to allow vehicles to pass, and also allow school children to see clearly and to cross safely. With so many road works currently in Churchdown, this is the only road free from roadworks, meaning many more vehicles are currently using this route.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34,36, Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
